subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I think I'm
going to talk about Wicca today. It's
not the subject that I had in mind
originally, but it just popped into my
head, let's talk about Wicca, witchcraft.
If there's a spiritual tradition that
has strong parapsychological elements,
Wicca would be it. I can tell you
this, there was a time in my life when I
spent a lot of time hanging around with
the practitioners of Wicca who lived in
Berkeley, California. And I have to say, I
loved those people. We had rituals that we
conducted in the big grove of those
Australian gum trees, eucalyptus trees on
the Berkeley campus, an enormous circle of
eucalyptus trees where the Wiccans would
gather and celebrate their - its really
not so much a faith as a culture. But,
they were beautiful people, and there
were many different groups of people who
practiced Wicca or something similar.
There was the New Reformed Order of the
Golden Dawn, there was the Reformed
Druids of North America in Berkeley, in
those years. I was actually quite
close, very fond of those people
for some time. I think it would be
fair to say I was integrated into that
group of people. They were really, I
guess you'd have to say an amalgamation
of pagans of various types, people into
different sorts of esoteric cultures,
Tarot reading, Kabbalah, astrology,
herbalism, and it was a good time
for me. In many ways it was the
springboard from which I began to launch
a career,
a more serious career in parapsychology.
I think I've told this story once before,
but it's worth repeating because when I
first went to Berkeley in 1970, I met
Frank X. Barron. I made a point of going
down to Santa Cruz, where he was a
professor at the University of
California at Santa Cruz. This was
early on in my criminology
graduate career at Berkeley. In fact,
what I had hoped to do was to kind of
combine criminology and my interest in
mysticism and do a special independent
study on the effects of isolation, of
living alone. It's a big interest to
criminologists, because of course they put
prisoners into isolation. And, furthermore,
there's the issue of what happens when
somebody escapes a prison and then
perhaps they're in a forest somewhere
and they have to live all by themselves
in a forest. How can they survive? How
long can we expect them to survive? What
are they likely to do, and so on? But,
my interest was really more personal. I
was interested in isolation to see how
it would affect my consciousness. I
believe, as I've reported earlier, that I
was studying a magical grimoire, called
The Book of the Sacred Magic of
Abramnelin the Mage. That book
describes a magical ritual, the
preparation of which requires six months
of living in total sensory isolation.
Well, not sensory really - total social
isolation for six months. I was
actually contemplating putting myself
through that ritual and at the same time
writing an independent study project at
the university.
Who better, I thought, to discuss these
things with than Frank Barron, who was
a specialist in the psychology of
creativity.
Well, I admired his book, Creativity and
Psychological Health. That's why I
went to see him and studied that book as
an undergraduate back at the University
of Wisconsin in the 1960s. Frank
Barron was a wonderful guy. He's the
kind of psychologist who tried to study
some of the great creative thinkers of
his time. I know, for example, he wanted to
study the writer Norman Mailer.
Mailer was a boxer. Mailer insisted that
Frank Barrorn get into the boxing ring
with himn, so he did. That's the kind of
person he was. When I met with him,
he's one of the people who encouraged me
to add a parapsychological
element to this research, the solitude
project in which I was engaging in.
He also told me an experience of his own.
He had met
a student of his, probably was,
because there were lots of students into
Wicca. He said he met a student, I'm going
to say a student but maybe it was a
person who was a witch. He was curious
and he was sitting at home in his study
and thinking to himself, "OK, witch, if
you're real prove your power." At that
moment, synchronistically, from out of who
knows where, a stone came and hit the
window outside of his study, it made a
loud noise and got his attention. He
thought to himself, "Hm, maybe there is
something to witchcraft. Maybe there's
something to this Wicca." What,
presumably it entails, you could call it
manifestation. The rituals of witchcraft
have a lot to do with manifestation
including, one might say, at a
psychokinetic level.
I mention it because it occurs to me
that maybe I've had more than a passing
interest in psychokinesis because it
wasn't long after I moved away from my
Wicca friends and into more
serious academic studies that I
encountered Ted Owens, The Pk Man, and
began researching him. I really can't
say that I've personally had any obvious
examples of psychokinesis in my life.
I've never caused objects to levitate,
I've never attempted to influence the weather
the way Ted Owens did. But, I did endeavor
to manifest. What I endeavored to
manifest at the time when I met Ted
Owens, and I said this before, it
deserves
repetition, he said to me as we began his
training, "What would you like to do if
you had this power?" I thought about
it and I said, "Well, really, what I want to
do is become a communicator to the
mainstream of our society about the
realities that are known in the psychic
and esoteric and occult worlds.
I want to manifest myself as that kind
of a communicator." Surely, that has
happened. I'm doing this YouTube
channel now, but I realize that when I
was on public television I had hundreds
of millions of views, because we were out
on the satellite and carried by as many
as a hundred stations across North
America. I'm setting a goal, and I'll
let you know what that goal is right now.
I want to see this YouTube channel
achieve as many viewers as we had on
public television. So, I'm talking
about hundreds of millions.
We're up over two and a half million now.
So, basically I'm looking for a
hundredfold increase, because I want to reach
people, I want to create that army
of telepathic monkeys, or telepathic apes,
that I've referred to in an earlier "In
Presence." So, the question that you might
be thinking about for yourself at this
point is: is there a little bit of a
Wiccan, a witch in you? Do you ever find
that sometimes the universe just assists
you a little bit and you're able to
manifest things in uncanny, inexplicable
ways? I know in a Judaeo-Christian culture,
the cultivation of witchcraft, the
possibilities implicit in the culture of
witchcraft are frowned upon. But, doesn't
that make it even all the more enticing
for some of you, or not? I can say this,
from my personal acquaintance with many
practitioners of witchcraft, I find them
to be lovely people. Sometimes they can
be a little rough, sometimes they can be
a little vindictive. But, then again,
people who are practitioners of the anti-
witchcraft religions also can be a bit
rough and vindictive too. In fact,
let's face it, the Christian culture in
the Middle Ages went to great lengths to
wipe out witchcraft. I think the
statistics show that maybe as many as
100,000 witches were burned at
the stake. Well, people who were
characterized as witches. They may not
have even been actual practitioners. But
perhaps somebody was jealous of their
property, or somebody got sick and wanted
to blame somebody else.
But in any case, it was a fury. Now,
my mentor Arthur Young once put it this
way,
he said, "If you want to talk about
paradigm shifts, I'll tell you a paradigm
shift. Only a few hundred years ago we
burned witches at the stake, and now
the mainstream paradigm is that
witchcraft does not exist. There is no
such thing. Well, which witch is it?" So,
from my point of view, if you feel a
little witchy occasionally, that's a
healthy thing, a good thing. Once
again, of course I would remind you of
Rudolf Steiner's quote that I love to
repeat which is, "Take two steps towards
developing your character before you
take one step toward knowledge or power."
But, I will say that I think
practitioners of Wicca are interested in
knowledge and power. I suspect that
anybody viewing this video today might
have such an interest as well. So, all the
more reason to develop your character
more strongly. I'll leave you with
those thoughts. Once again, thank you for
being with me.
